body.p:
Hopkinsville Kentucky
July 6th 1863
His Excellency.
James F. Robinson
Dear Sir

I am under the impression my Commission as Notary Public for Christian has expired. Will be kind enough to grant me another -- I am mostly called upon to render gratuitious service to Heirs of deceased soldiers --
and should you deserve to know Whether I am Strictly Loyal ask my old and Honored friend John J. Crittenden -- to Whom I desire you Will give my best respects.
You Sir I have been from the first and am now for Coertion -- Subjugation -- Confiscation and hanging Traitors
We have been too lenient with the scoundrels -- None of them have appreciated the favours shown them -- our men from this out Will take but few prisoners and that is my advice to the Soldiers

Christian Co
Notary
Issue & send Comm He is so home
D. S. Hays
Appd July 20th 1863
